page.title: 02THE VILLAGE OF WOLSTON
page.content: Wolston is a very pretty village, with a stream running through into the River Avon, crossed by many bridges, with a mixture of old and new houses. There is a{population}of 2,200+, the majority of the inhabitants commuting to Coventry or Rugby. The village is concentrated mainly in one kilometre square surrounded by open fields and farmland. The{village green}is the scene of Morris dancing and the site of the War Memorial, where the Service of Remembrance is held each year. The most{historic house}in Wolston is The Priory now belonging to the village doctor, but which was once the site of St. Peter's Benedictine Abbey C1090, (said originally to be connected by a secret passage to{St. Margaret's {Church)}and where, in the 16th century, the Marprelate Tracts were illegally printed.
